title: What ELLE Editors Are Buying From SSENSE’s Epic Sale
description: Because if there’s one thing we know, it’s how to shop.
excerpt: Brace yourselves, the 2025 SSENSE sale is live. To help you find the best pieces, our editors share what they’ll be shopping from the sale. See them all now.
text: Jacquemus Les Classiques ‘La Maille Jacquemus’ Sweater“I literally cannot help myself from buying gray sweaters! I love this Jacquemus piece for the silhouette.”—Alexis Wolfe, fashion & market accessories directorRepetto Cendrillon Ballerina Flats“Nothing is more classic than a ballet flat. Repetto makes some of the best, ideal for the office or being a woman on the go. The French really do it better, as they say!”—Claire Stern Milch, digital directorAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowDries Van Noten Orange Draped Peplum Midi Skirt“This bright orange skirt will surely be a key item in any wardrobe. Team it with a black turtleneck and tights for the chicest, minimalist look, then, as the season warms up, opt for a white T-shirt or lace blouse and flats instead.”—Alex White, fashion directorToteme Brown Tee Midi Dress“This dress is an iconic Toteme design that’s perfect for everyday wear, and it comes in the color of the year: mocha mousse. How could I resist?”—Alexis Bennett Parker, commerce content leadAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowJil Sander Giro Wallet“This is a great little wallet to run to a quick coffee or lunch with. Not only is it chic, but holds all of your credit cards and IDs.”—Alexis Wolfe, fashion & market accessories directorLisa Yang Kerry Sweater“This season, I’m embracing brushed cashmere for an undeniably luxurious take on texture, and no one does it quite like Lisa Yang. I love the light blue hue combined with this relaxed polo style and I will most definitely be wearing it now through early spring.”—Dale Arden Chong, senior fashion commerce editorAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowBottega Veneta Tortoiseshell Pointed Cat-Eye Sunglasses“Everyone should own a pair of cat-eye sunglasses, and this particular pair in tortoiseshell has the perfect proportions.”—Alex White, fashion directorCourrèges Ribbed Camisole“You can never have too many black camis, whether under a fuzzy sweater or showing off a vacation glow. I love the chic simplicity of this one from Courrèges!”—Madison Rexroat, assistant accessories editorAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowDries Van Noten Leather Heeled Sandals“A colorful shoe is essential. This asymmetric heel in a lilac hue will complete any outfit.”—Alex White, fashion directorMaria Black Maya Huggie Single Earring“Sculptural jewelry is what all the coolest girls are wearing these days, and in my eternal quest to be one of them, I’m obviously jumping on board.”—Meg Donohue, associate fashion commerce editorAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowGolden Goose Marathon M2000 Sneakers“My Golden Goose Marathon runners have been on rotation for the past year. I’m excited to add the M2000 to my sneaker collection!”—Alexis Wolfe, fashion & market accessories directorCarven Short Split Suede Coat“This suede jacket can be worn with jeans or a miniskirt. It makes even the most simple outfit look put-together.”—Alex White, fashion directorAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowJacquemus Le Chouchou ‘Les Mules Plates Ballet’f Ballerina Flats“Balletcore is very much still happening, but for a typically anti-pink girl like me, these Jacquemus slides are the perfect answer to add some edge to the trend.”—Madison Rexroat, assistant accessories editorMarge Sherwood Large Bag“I’ve had a huge shopping crush on Marge Sherwood for, well, forever. If I had to dream up by ideal bag shape and size for everyday use, this would be it. And now it’s on sale! I’m being very brave by opting for brown rather than my sticking to my all-black comfort zone. If I can do it, so can you.”—Meg Donohue, associate fashion commerce editorAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowPort Tanger Ice Studios Edition Nunny“I’m always after an amazing pair of oversized black sunnies (you can never have too many) and Port Tanger is one of my favorite sunglasses brands to shop. Chic, but with a twist!”—Madison Rexroat, assistant accessories editorMaison Margiela Cut-Out Jeans“Despite the re-emergence of skinny jeans as a trend, I’m still very much into baggy jeans. These from Maison Margiela have the perfect nipped-waist-wide-leg silhouette, with some cheekiness thrown in with the side slits.”—Madison Rexroat, assistant accessories editorAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowJW Anderson Off-White Kitten Heels“Boat shoes were everywhere this past spring. Next up: the kitten heel version.”—Alex White, fashion directorVivienne Westwood Classic Gloves“I bought vintage Vivienne Westwood leather gloves last fall, and it basically changed my life. I’d label them as a must-have winter accessory, and this pair is nearly identical to mine. Side effects may include: a confidence boost, talking with a posh accent, and being mistaken for someone who’s terribly rich.”—Meg Donohue, associate fashion commerce editorAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowStaud Tommy Beaded Bag“I’m a champion of zebra print overtaking leopard this year, so I’ll always say yes to Staud’s beaded zebra Tommy bag. One of my besties has this very same bag, and I’m jealous every time I see it, so now’s the perfect time to get it on sale.”—Madison Rexroat, assistant accessories editorRay-Ban Mega Wayfarer Sunglasses“No matter how many pairs of sunglasses I try, I always go back to my trusty Wayfarers. A backup is always a good idea.”—Claire Stern Milch, digital director
html:
Jacquemus Les Classiques ‘La Maille Jacquemus’ Sweater

“I literally cannot help myself from buying gray sweaters! I love this Jacquemus piece for the silhouette.”—Alexis Wolfe, fashion & market accessories director

Repetto Cendrillon Ballerina Flats

“Nothing is more classic than a ballet flat. Repetto makes some of the best, ideal for the office or being a woman on the go. The French really do it better, as they say!”—Claire Stern Milch, digital director

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Dries Van Noten Orange Draped Peplum Midi Skirt

“This bright orange skirt will surely be a key item in any wardrobe. Team it with a black turtleneck and tights for the chicest, minimalist look, then, as the season warms up, opt for a white T-shirt or lace blouse and flats instead.”—Alex White, fashion director

Toteme Brown Tee Midi Dress

“This dress is an iconic Toteme design that’s perfect for everyday wear, and it comes in the color of the year: mocha mousse. How could I resist?”—Alexis Bennett Parker, commerce content lead

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Jil Sander Giro Wallet

“This is a great little wallet to run to a quick coffee or lunch with. Not only is it chic, but holds all of your credit cards and IDs.”—Alexis Wolfe, fashion & market accessories director

Lisa Yang Kerry Sweater

“This season, I’m embracing brushed cashmere for an undeniably luxurious take on texture, and no one does it quite like Lisa Yang. I love the light blue hue combined with this relaxed polo style and I will most definitely be wearing it now through early spring.”—Dale Arden Chong, senior fashion commerce editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Bottega Veneta Tortoiseshell Pointed Cat-Eye Sunglasses

“Everyone should own a pair of cat-eye sunglasses, and this particular pair in tortoiseshell has the perfect proportions.”—Alex White, fashion director

Courrèges Ribbed Camisole

“You can never have too many black camis, whether under a fuzzy sweater or showing off a vacation glow. I love the chic simplicity of this one from Courrèges!”—Madison Rexroat, assistant accessories editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Dries Van Noten Leather Heeled Sandals

“A colorful shoe is essential. This asymmetric heel in a lilac hue will complete any outfit.”—Alex White, fashion director

Maria Black Maya Huggie Single Earring

“Sculptural jewelry is what all the coolest girls are wearing these days, and in my eternal quest to be one of them, I’m obviously jumping on board.”—Meg Donohue, associate fashion commerce editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Golden Goose Marathon M2000 Sneakers

“My Golden Goose Marathon runners have been on rotation for the past year. I’m excited to add the M2000 to my sneaker collection!”—Alexis Wolfe, fashion & market accessories director

Carven Short Split Suede Coat

“This suede jacket can be worn with jeans or a miniskirt. It makes even the most simple outfit look put-together.”—Alex White, fashion director

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Jacquemus Le Chouchou ‘Les Mules Plates Ballet’f Ballerina Flats

“Balletcore is very much still happening, but for a typically anti-pink girl like me, these Jacquemus slides are the perfect answer to add some edge to the trend.”—Madison Rexroat, assistant accessories editor

Marge Sherwood Large Bag

“I’ve had a huge shopping crush on Marge Sherwood for, well, forever. If I had to dream up by ideal bag shape and size for everyday use, this would be it. And now it’s on sale! I’m being very brave by opting for brown rather than my sticking to my all-black comfort zone. If I can do it, so can you.”—Meg Donohue, associate fashion commerce editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Port Tanger Ice Studios Edition Nunny

“I’m always after an amazing pair of oversized black sunnies (you can never have too many) and Port Tanger is one of my favorite sunglasses brands to shop. Chic, but with a twist!”—Madison Rexroat, assistant accessories editor

Maison Margiela Cut-Out Jeans

“Despite the re-emergence of skinny jeans as a trend, I’m still very much into baggy jeans. These from Maison Margiela have the perfect nipped-waist-wide-leg silhouette, with some cheekiness thrown in with the side slits.”—Madison Rexroat, assistant accessories editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

JW Anderson Off-White Kitten Heels

“Boat shoes were everywhere this past spring. Next up: the kitten heel version.”—Alex White, fashion director

Vivienne Westwood Classic Gloves

“I bought vintage Vivienne Westwood leather gloves last fall, and it basically changed my life. I’d label them as a must-have winter accessory, and this pair is nearly identical to mine. Side effects may include: a confidence boost, talking with a posh accent, and being mistaken for someone who’s terribly rich.”—Meg Donohue, associate fashion commerce editor

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Staud Tommy Beaded Bag

“I’m a champion of zebra print overtaking leopard this year, so I’ll always say yes to Staud’s beaded zebra Tommy bag. One of my besties has this very same bag, and I’m jealous every time I see it, so now’s the perfect time to get it on sale.”—Madison Rexroat, assistant accessories editor

Ray-Ban Mega Wayfarer Sunglasses

“No matter how many pairs of sunglasses I try, I always go back to my trusty Wayfarers. A backup is always a good idea.”—Claire Stern Milch, digital director
